channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Syrian stock exchange reopens after a 6-month hiatus as part of U.S.-led push for a new free market economy
item.description: Stock trading resumed in Damascus after a six-month pause that began in December.

item.title: Jewish House lawmaker urges deportation of Boulder terror suspect's family
item.description: Rep. Randy Fine is speaking out about the suspected terror attack in Boulder, Colorado, during a peaceful pro-Israel demonstration.

item.title: Gen Z men studying an MBA will see a 75% salary bump—that’s 25% more than women with the same qualification
item.description: Male MBA graduates make $36,000 more than their female counterparts and the disparity begins with their first job out of school.

item.title: What Are We Going to Do About Abortion?
item.description: In the third year since the end of Roe , let’s stop wasting time.

item.title: Sorry, Mr. President: If You Want Tariffs, You Need Congress
item.description: Trump’s claim that he can enact global tariffs unilaterally is constitutionally dubious.

item.title: A Flawed Portrait of Bill Buckley
item.description: Sam Tanenhaus deserves credit for the care he took in the research and writing, but the epic biography is blighted by his hobbyhorses.

item.title: False Promises: Sexual Liberation Hurts Us All
item.description: A new book details how the sexual revolution has backfired and has severely damaged Western society.

item.title: Chime chases $11 billion valuation in IPO set for next week on Nasdaq
item.description: Crypto firm Circle is also going public with goals of a $7.2 billion valuation.

item.title: Fetterman, McCormick react to 'astonishing' Boulder attack on pro-Israel group: 'Rank antisemitism'
item.description: Sens. John Fetterman and Dave McCormick spoke out strongly against recent attacks on pro-Israel groups during a bipartisan forum in Boston on Monday.

item.title: Why It’s Hard To Make Sense Of The ‘Mishmash’ In Republicans’ ‘Big, Beautiful Bill’
item.description: Even if the bill passes and gets signed into law, the policy muddle inside it will prove difficult to explain and defend.

item.title: SCOTUS Rejects Second Amendment Challenges To Maryland AR-15 Ban, Rhode Island Magazine Cap
item.description: ‘Our Constitution allows the American people — not the government — to decide which weapons are useful for self defense,’ Thomas dissented.

item.title: SCOTUS Agrees To Decide Case On Candidates’ Standing To Challenge Election Laws
item.description: The U.S. Supreme Court agreed on Monday to take up a case involving questions surrounding federal candidate litigation of state election regulations. ...

item.title: Laurene Powell Jobs has the inside track on friend Jony Ive’s collaboration with OpenAI—but still wants to see Apple succeed
item.description: Ive says a driver for the io-OpenAI design is the fact that "humanity deserves better" than an "uneasy" relationship with technology.

item.title: Beijing swipes back at Washington over trade, student visa restrictions
item.description: China on Monday accused the U.S. of violating the agreement both countries reached in Geneva to de-escalate trade tensions, the latest sign of frictio...

item.title: An Intellectual Renaissance Starts With Memorizing The Words That Made America
item.description: Only by immersing ourselves in the best words of our forbears will we recover something of the culture that made these words possible in the first pla...

item.title: Medicaid Reform Falls Short for People with Disabilities
item.description: The Senate should include reforms to ensure that the program can return to its original purpose of supporting the most vulnerable.

item.title: The transformation of women’s sports in Saudi Arabia is no mirage. Just ask the women
item.description: Women were barred from stadiums prior to 2018. Today, there’s a premier women’s soccer league with global sponsorships.

item.title: Maxine Waters campaign to pay $68K for violating campaign finance laws
item.description: Democratic Rep. Maxine Waters' campaign has agreed to pay a hefty fine for alleged campaign finance violations in 2020.

item.title: The Folly of an ‘Interim’ Agreement with Iran
item.description: It would neither produce long-term stability nor bring about Iranian nuclear disarmament.

item.title: Ukraine, Russia meet for peace talks in Istanbul after explosive weekend
item.description: Istanbul is hosting Russian-Ukrainian peace talks Monday amid heightened tensions after Ukraine's drone attack on Russian airfields, and unclaimed bri...

item.title: As Musk exits DOGE, a look back at previous efforts to cut waste, fraud and abuse – and how they fared
item.description: LBJ’s Pentagon reforms through Trump’s budget focus show decades of federal efforts to streamline and cut costs

item.title: Think We’ve Seen the Last +1,000-BPS High Yield Spread? Think Again
item.description: Think +1,000-bps high yield spreads are history? Marty Fridson shows why they could still hit that mark in the next recession.

item.title: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick calls trade court ruling against Trump tariffs 'silly'
item.description: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick called a U.S. Court of International Trade ruling that blocked President Trump's global tariffs "silly."

item.title: Progressive caucus chair warns Democrats that Elon Musk is not going away
item.description: Congressional Progressive Caucus Chair Greg Casar cautioned Democrats on Sunday not to believe Elon Musk when the tech billionaire says he is stepping...

item.title: List of 'sanctuary jurisdictions' removed from U.S. government website
item.description: A list of more than 500 "sanctuary jurisdictions" no longer appears on the Department of Homeland Security's website after receiving criticism for inc...

item.title: Video shows DHS agents detaining Nadler aide outside of congressional office
item.description: Federal agents were shown in a video handcuffing an aide to Rep. Jerry Nadler after authorities accused his staff of "harboring rioters" in his New Yo...

item.title: Tariffs, Inflation, and Returns: How Investments Respond to Supply Shocks
item.description: Learn how tariff-related inflation shocks ripple through markets—and which assets have historically helped investors navigate the turbulence.

item.title: Women in Alts: Leading with Inspiration, Intuition, and Impact
item.description: Women investors are redefining alternatives with bold leadership, values-driven decisions, and long-term impact.

item.title: The Downgrade Is Done. The Investor Response Is Just Beginning
item.description: The US downgrade won’t upend markets—but it may reshape sovereign risk models and investor assumptions. Here’s what to watch next.

item.title: Tariffs and Returns: Lessons from 150 Years of Market History
item.description: What 150 years of market data reveal about tariffs, growth, and investment returns—and how equity factors have historically delivered resilience.
